intro: Centratherum holtonii, commonly known as the Holton's centatherum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry climates. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
